snippet: The World Anti-Doping Agency’s decision to change its ban for athletes caught doping from two years to four has focused attention on the diligence of countries’ drug testing programs.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports Of The Times column notes that Anti-Doping Agency's decision to double the duration of bans for athletes who intentionally use performance-enhancing drugs to four years from two, has focused attention on the diligence of countries' drug testing programs in lead-up to Olympics; cites Jamaica as place where lax testing standards allow athletes to freely dope outside of competition, sometimes gaining lasting benefits.
lead_paragraph: The World Anti-Doping Agency’s decision to change its ban for athletes caught doping from two years to four has focused attention on the diligence of countries’ drug testing programs.

headline.main: Doping Rules Are Tougher Only if Applied
